creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
text: Cast in the form of a hoofed beast, this container was created to hold water for making ink. A finger hole is positioned on the animalâ€™s back, with the spout hole located in its mouth. By covering the finger hole, a controlled amount of water could be sprinkled onto the inkstone for the grinding of ink. The creature probably represents a qilin, an auspicious mythological animal of good omen, whose appearance at the imperial court was a sign of heavenly favor.
title: Waterdropper
